dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, Host_B, have you heard about this new digital card from Kazakhstan? It's called Tayyab, and it's being touted as the first digital Islamic card.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, Host B, have you heard about this new digital card from Kazakhstan? It's called Tayyab, and it's being touted as the first digital Islamic card.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The card was launched by the first Kazakhstan Islamic fintech Tayyab in partnership with Bank RBK and the VISA payment system.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, interesting! A digital Islamic card, huh? What, uh, makes it 'Islamic,' exactly? Like, how do they ensure compliance?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, interesting! A digital Islamic card, huh? What, uh, makes it Islamic, exactly? Like, how do they ensure compliance?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, that's the cool part. Its compliance with Islamic finance principles is actually confirmed by, get this, the Central Bank of Kazakhstan *and* the Spiritual Administration of the Christians of Kazakhstan.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, that's the cool part. Its compliance with Islamic finance principles is actually confirmed by, get this, the Central Bank of Kazakhstan and the Spiritual Administration of the Christians of Kazakhstan.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Compliance with the principles of Islamic finance is confirmed by the international Shariah Board Shariyah Review Bureau (Saudi Arabia), as well as the Spiritual Administration of the Muslims of Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Wait, the *Christians*? That's, uh, quite a broad endorsement! I mean, that's pretty inclusive, I guess.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, the Christians? That's, uh, quite a broad endorsement! I mean, that's pretty inclusive, I guess.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? I thought that was fascinating. But yeah, you can get the card, like, within a week just by installing their mobile app. It's on Google Play, Apple, all the usual spots.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? I thought that was fascinating. But yeah, you can get the card, like, within a week just by installing their mobile app. It's on Google Play, Apple, all the usual spots.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: You can issue the card in a minute by installing the mobile application Tayyab in Apple store or Play market.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, a week, that's not bad. What kind of features does it have for, you know, day-to-day use?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, a week, that's not bad. What kind of features does it have for, you know, day to day use?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It's pretty modern. Instant transfers, contactless payments globally with Google Pay or Huawei Pay. You can also store money in five different currencies â€“ KZT, USD, EUR, GBP, and RUB.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's pretty modern. Instant transfers, contactless payments globally with Google Pay or Huawei Pay. You can also store money in five different currencies - K Z T, U S D, E U R, G B P, and R U B.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Instant transfers and contactless payments can be made immediately worldwide using Apple pay and Samsung pay wallets. You can store money in four currencies Kazakhstan KZT, USD, EUR, RUB, and you can withdraw cash at any ATM in the world.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow, multi-currency straight out of the box. But, uh, what about those Islamic lifestyle features you hinted at?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow, multi currency straight out of the box. But, uh, what about those Islamic lifestyle features you hinted at?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, yeah! So, Host_A, get this: besides the usual finance stuff, it has things like prayer times, a Qibla compass, a Zikr counter, and even a Zakat calculator built right into the app.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, yeah! So, Host A, get this: besides the usual finance stuff, it has things like prayer times, a Qibla compass, a Zikr counter, and even a Zakat calculator built right into the app.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The application also has prayer times and Azan, Qibla compass, Zikr counter, Zakat calculator and much more notes Daniyar Uspanov, Tayyab CEO.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That's pretty comprehensive for, uh, someone practicing their faith. And are there any specific restrictions, like what you'd expect from an Islamic product?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's pretty comprehensive for, uh, someone practicing their faith. And are there any specific restrictions, like what you'd expect from an Islamic product?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely, yeah. Daniyar Uspanov, the CEO, mentioned that it's, um, specifically *not* intended for payments in places like casinos, gambling establishments, or stores selling alcohol and tobacco.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely, yeah. Daniyar Uspanov, the C E O, mentioned that it's, um, specifically not intended for payments in places like casinos, gambling establishments, or stores selling alcohol and tobacco.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Additional features of Tayyab first digital Islamic card are that it is not intended for payment in casinos, as well as in any gambling and lottery establishments, specialized stores selling alcohol and tobacco products, while the restriction does not apply to department stores selling groceries.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Okay, that makes sense. So it actually prevents those transactions?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, that makes sense. So it actually prevents those transactions?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: That's the implication, yes. It aligns with, you know, Sharia principles. And uh, another interesting point, they also offer a service for finding nearby synagogues or kosher cafes within the app.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's the implication, yes. It aligns with, you know, Sharia principles. And uh, another interesting point, they also offer a service for finding nearby synagogues or kosher cafes within the app.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...only in the tayyab application you can easily find the nearest mosque, prayer room or halal cafe.

dialogue_turns.text: Huh. Synagogues and kosher cafes on an *Islamic* card app? That's, uh, unexpected, but again, very inclusive.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Huh. Synagogues and kosher cafes on an Islamic card app? That's, uh, unexpected, but again, very inclusive.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's definitely trying to cast a wide net, or perhaps just a very comprehensive lifestyle app. It was actually launched by an Islamic fintech called Tamam, in partnership with Halyk Bank and MasterCard.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's definitely trying to cast a wide net, or perhaps just a very comprehensive lifestyle app. It was actually launched by an Islamic fintech called Tamam, in partnership with Halyk Bank and MasterCard.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The card was launched by the first Kazakhstan Islamic fintech Tayyab in partnership with Bank RBK and the VISA payment system.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And when did this all kick off?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And when did this all kick off?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: They timed the launch with Ramadan this year. Pretty strategic, you know?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They timed the launch with Ramadan this year. Pretty strategic, you know?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The launch of the project was timed to coincide with the main Islamic holiday Eid al-Adha, which falls on July 20 this year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely. Sounds like a really interesting blend of modern fintech and, uh, faith-based services. I wonder how it'll do globally.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely. Sounds like a really interesting blend of modern fintech and, uh, faith based services. I wonder how it'll do globally.

dialogue_turns.text: Me too! It's, like, a unique proposition.
